rename.from: Change calling fixtures directly into a warning instead of an error
rename.to: Change calling fixtures directly into an error instead of a warning

issue.title: Calling fixtures directly is now an error instead of a warning

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

body: So why was this a problem that warrants an actual error?

Hi @yousefcodes,

Please take a look at https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/deprecations.html#calling-fixtures-directly, paraphrasing:

> This is a great source of confusion to new users, which will often call the fixture functions and request them from test functions interchangeably, which breaks the fixture resolution model.

Another problem is that we plan to introduce fixture objects at some point in the future, which will effectively make `@pytest.fixture`-decorated-functions no longer an actual function object.

issue.title: "make dev" fails when calling test_data.py

repository.name: OpenOversight
repository.description: Police oversight and accountability through public data ðŸ‘®

issue.body:
It looks like this went from a deprecation warning to a hard error when pytest was upgraded from 4.0.2 --> 5.2.2 [e1393a2e](https://github.com/lucyparsons/OpenOversight/commit/e1393a2e413fc7dc4410e6a6102c2ef53750164f#diff-913fedaed3cb05fe362c0ceb35e2d827)
pytest issue in 4.1.0 enforcing this behavior: [#4545](https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/issues/4545)
```
## Populate database with test data
docker-compose run --rm web python ../test_data.py -p
Starting openoversight_postgres_1 ... done
[2019-12-20 20:04:25,179] INFO in __init__: OpenOversight startup
[2019-12-20 20:04:25,436] INFO in __init__: OpenOversight startup
[*] Populating database with test data...
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "../test_data.py", line 25, in <module>
    mockdata(db.session)
  File "/ve/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/fixtures.py", line 978, in result
    fail(message, pytrace=False)
  File "/ve/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/outcomes.py", line 128, in fail
    raise Failed(msg=msg, pytrace=pytrace)
Failed: Fixture "mockdata" called directly. Fixtures are not meant to be called directly,
but are created automatically when test functions request them as parameters.
See https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/fixture.html for more information about fixtures, and
https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/deprecations.html#calling-fixtures-directly about how to update your code.
make: *** [populate] Error 1
```
A current workaround is to revert pytest to version 4.0.2
